body:
I can confirm this...

```
$ mkdir -p src/dir
$ echo hello > src/dir/file.txt
$ tree src
src
└── dir
    └── file.txt

1 directory, 1 file
$ rclone move -vv --delete-empty-src-dirs --disable DirMove src dst
2018/07/02 14:04:14 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.42-016-g97beff53" starting with parameters ["rclone" "move" "-vv" "--delete-empty-src-dirs" "--disable" "DirMove" "src" "dst"]
2018/07/02 14:04:14 DEBUG : Using config file from "/home/ncw/.rclone.conf"
2018/07/02 14:04:14 DEBUG : Reset feature "DirMove"
2018/07/02 14:04:14 DEBUG : Reset feature "DirMove"
2018/07/02 14:04:14 INFO  : Local file system at /tmp/dst: Waiting for checks to finish
2018/07/02 14:04:14 INFO  : Local file system at /tmp/dst: Waiting for transfers to finish
2018/07/02 14:04:14 INFO  : dir/file.txt: Moved (server side)
2018/07/02 14:04:14 INFO  : 
Transferred:      0 Bytes (0 Bytes/s)
Errors:                 0
Checks:                 0
Transferred:            1
Elapsed time:          0s

2018/07/02 14:04:14 DEBUG : 2 go routines active
2018/07/02 14:04:14 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.42-016-g97beff53" finishing with parameters ["rclone" "move" "-vv" "--delete-empty-src-dirs" "--disable" "DirMove" "src" "dst"]
$ 
$ tree src
src
└── dir

1 directory, 0 files
$ tree dst
dst
└── dir
    └── file.txt

1 directory, 1 file
```

It does work with 1.41 - a bit of bisecting reveals this is the problem

```
commit 737aed8412c28641fcd82755b74346b00e9e1cd9
Author: ishuah <kariuki@ishuah.com>
Date:   Mon May 14 20:16:56 2018 +0300

    Ensure items in srcEmptyDirs are actually empty

:040000 040000 e86f9cf64558491328cef3833970e26ac9fed51d 8da1b952c1eb90a2064b46714dcc38faaab6333d M	fs
```

Any ideas why 737aed8412c28641fcd82755b74346b00e9e1cd9 broke this @ishuah ?

It would be a good software engineering to first make a failing test then fix it

issue.title: s3: Support empty "directory" keys

milestone.title: Help Wanted
milestone.description:
Enhancements which might be useful, but currently aren't planned.

Any help doing these much appreciated.

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
Many tools like the the AWS S3 Console, S3 network drives / fuse filesystems and various other tools create "directories" on S3 by creating zero byte keys that end with a slash to emulate empty directories.

rclone currently can't handle these keys, because it tries to treat them like a file instead of a directory and fails with an error if a local directory with the same name exist.

Instead rclone should detect these keys and treat them like a directory.

The keys are easy to detect, because they always end with a slash and have a content-length of 0 bytes.

Here's an example key listed with the python aws cli:

```
aws s3api head-object --bucket bito-pim-images --key 'images/WebShop/ita_IT/'
{
    "AcceptRanges": "bytes",
    "ContentType": "binary/octet-stream",
    "LastModified": "Fri, 22 Jul 2016 12:32:11 GMT",
    "ContentLength": 0,
    "ETag": "\"d41d8cd98f00b204e9800998ecf8427e\"",
    "Metadata": {}
}
```

> What is your rclone version (eg output from `rclone -V`)

v1.33-DEV

> Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)

macOS 10.12.1

> Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)

s3

> The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

`rclone sync --size-only --delete-after remote:tmp /tmp`

> A log from the command with the `-v` flag (eg output from `rclone -v copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

```
2016/09/30 22:09:55 Local file system at /Volumes/EXT4TBA/images: Waiting for transfers to finish
2016/09/30 22:09:55 images/WebShop/ita_IT/: Failed to copy: open /Volumes/EXT4TBA/images/WebShop/ita_IT: is a directory
2016/09/30 22:09:55 images/WebShop/nld_BE/: Failed to copy: open /Volumes/EXT4TBA/images/WebShop/nld_BE: is a directory
2016/09/30 22:09:55 images/WebShop/nld_NL/: Failed to copy: open /Volumes/EXT4TBA/images/WebShop/nld_NL: is a directory
2016/09/30 22:09:55 images/WebShop/pol_PL/: Failed to copy: open /Volumes/EXT4TBA/images/WebShop/pol_PL: is a directory
2016/09/30 22:09:56 images/WebShop/slo_SK/: Failed to copy: open /Volumes/EXT4TBA/images/WebShop/slo_SK: is a directory
2016/09/30 22:09:56 images/WebShop/spa_ES/: Failed to copy: open /Volumes/EXT4TBA/images/WebShop/spa_ES: is a directory
2016/09/30 22:09:56 images/WebShop/ukrainian_ukraine/: Failed to copy: open /Volumes/EXT4TBA/images/WebShop/ukrainian_ukraine: is a directory
2016/09/30 22:09:56 Local file system at /Volumes/EXT4TBA/images: not deleting files as there were IO errors
2016/09/30 22:09:56 Attempt 3/3 failed with 30 errors and: not deleting files as there were IO errors
2016/09/30 22:09:56 Failed to sync: not deleting files as there were IO errors
```

It's very easy to create a test key by going into the AWS S3 Console and clicking on "Create Folder" to create an empty directory.

body:
@KurtzPT I see where it's breaking.

I added a line [to remove a dir from the `srcEmptyDirs` map if the dir has/had a file](https://github.com/ncw/rclone/commit/737aed8412c28641fcd82755b74346b00e9e1cd9#diff-d8b244ed617bc56f995832314f1fef10R741). So when processing a `move`, all dirs which had files before the move won't be in the `srcEmptyDirs` map, meaning they won't be deleted.

Testing with an empty second src dir proves this:
```
$ mkdir -p src/dir
$ mkdir src/dir2
$ echo hello > src/dir/hello.txt
$ tree src
src
├── dir
│   └── file.txt
└── dir2

2 directories, 1 file
$ rclone move -vv --delete-empty-src-dirs --disable DirMove src dst
2018/07/11 15:29:15 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.42" starting with parameters ["rclone" "move" "-vv" "--delete-empty-src-dirs" "--disable" "DirMove" "src" "dst"]
2018/07/11 15:29:15 DEBUG : Using config file from "/Users/ishuahkariuki/.config/rclone/rclone.conf"
2018/07/11 15:29:15 DEBUG : Reset feature "DirMove"
2018/07/11 15:29:15 DEBUG : Reset feature "DirMove"
2018/07/11 15:29:15 INFO  : Local file system at /Users/ishuahkariuki/Workshop/go_workshop/src/github.com/ncw/lab/dst: Waiting for checks to finish
2018/07/11 15:29:15 INFO  : Local file system at /Users/ishuahkariuki/Workshop/go_workshop/src/github.com/ncw/lab/dst: Waiting for transfers to finish
2018/07/11 15:29:15 INFO  : dir/file.txt: Moved (server side)
2018/07/11 15:29:15 DEBUG : Local file system at /Users/ishuahkariuki/Workshop/go_workshop/src/github.com/ncw/lab/dst: copied 1 directories
2018/07/11 15:29:15 DEBUG : dir2: Removing directory
2018/07/11 15:29:15 DEBUG : Local file system at /Users/ishuahkariuki/Workshop/go_workshop/src/github.com/ncw/lab/src: deleted 1 directories
2018/07/11 15:29:15 INFO  :
Transferred:      0 Bytes (0 Bytes/s)
Errors:                 0
Checks:                 0
Transferred:            1
Elapsed time:          0s

2018/07/11 15:29:15 DEBUG : 4 go routines active
2018/07/11 15:29:15 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.42" finishing with parameters ["rclone" "move" "-vv" "--delete-empty-src-dirs" "--disable" "DirMove" "src" "dst"]
$ tree src
src
└── dir

1 directory, 0 files
$ tree dst
dst
├── dir
│   └── file.txt
└── dir2

2 directories, 1 file
```
@ncw I'll write proper tests for this before fixing it.

issue.title: move: fix delete-empty-src-dirs flag - fixes #2372

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
This PR fixes an issue with the `--delete-empty-src-dirs` flag on move where not all empty dirs would not get delete on successful move.

Fixes - #2372

body: I am using version 1.43 and I am still experiencing this. Is it possible that the fix has been missed out of 1.43?

@WeKnowMC that fix is definitely in 1.43

The problem as I reformulated in my reply to the original issue is fixed (I just checked), but there may be more problems!

Can you make an example like the one I made above showing the problem and make a [new issue on github](https://github.com/ncw/rclone/issues/new) with that in?

Thanks

@andreluisos thank you for your feedback! 
Can you create [a new issue](https://github.com/ncw/rclone/issues/new) with an example illustrating your issue?
